security_audit.summary: Pure documentation-based skill containing only workflow instructions. No executable code, no file access, no network operations. All capabilities described are standard git and GitHub Actions operations for release management.

content.value_statement: Manually releasing software versions involves multiple git commands, version bumping, and GitHub workflow steps that are error-prone. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for creating versioned releases with proper tag naming conventions and workflow timing.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through monorepo release process
Determine version bump type from commit messages
Provide git commands for merging and tagging
Generate proper commit messages with conventional format
Create prefixed tags for multiple plugins
limitations: Does not execute git commands automatically
Requires manual review of pre-release checklist
User must wait for GitHub Actions workflow to complete
No automated changelog generation beyond described workflow

best_practices: Always start releases from the dev branch, never commit directly to main
Wait for the GitHub Actions workflow to complete before pushing to dev to avoid cancelling the stable deploy
Release plugins separately when both plugins have changed in the same cycle
anti_patterns: Pushing to dev branch before the stable workflow completes
Skipping the pre-release checklist (type-check, lint, tests, build)
Using incorrect tag prefixes or mismatched version numbers

faq.question: Does this skill execute git commands automatically?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides step-by-step instructions. You must run each git command manually to maintain control over the release process.

faq.question: What happens if I push to dev too early?
faq.answer: GitHub Actions uses concurrency groups. Pushing to dev before the stable workflow finishes will cancel the stable deploy, requiring you to re-push the tag.

faq.question: How do I determine the version bump type?
faq.answer: Review commits since the last tag. Breaking changes require major bumps, new features require minor bumps, and bug fixes require patch bumps.

faq.question: Can I release both plugins at once?
faq.answer: No. The workflow requires releasing plugins separately with their own prefixed tags to trigger individual GitHub Actions workflows.

faq.question: What tag format is required?
faq.answer: Tags must include the plugin prefix: downloader-vX.Y.Z for Stash Downloader or browser-vX.Y.Z for Stash Browser. Without the prefix, the workflow will not trigger.

faq.question: What if the GitHub Actions workflow fails?
faq.answer: Check the workflow logs for errors. Fix the issue in dev, then re-run the release process. You may need to delete and re-create the tag.
